intro: Cluytiandra fruticans, commonly known as the tropical climbing plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink or purple flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
